member.name: COPYFILE2_MESSAGE_ACTION
member.summary: Returned by theCopyFile2ProgressRoutine callback function to indicate what action should be taken for the pending copy operation.

member.name: COPYFILE2_MESSAGE_ACTION.COPYFILE2_PROGRESS_CANCEL
member.summary: Cancel the copy operation. The call will fail and return HRESULT_FROM_WIN32(ERROR_REQUEST_ABORTED) and any partially copied fragments will be deleted.

member.name: COPYFILE2_MESSAGE_ACTION.COPYFILE2_PROGRESS_STOP
member.summary: Stop the copy operation. The call will fail and return HRESULT_FROM_WIN32(ERROR_REQUEST_ABORTED) and any partially copied fragments will be left intact. The operation can be restarted using theCOPY_FILE_RESUME_FROM_PAUSE flag only if theCOPY_FILE_RESTARTABLE flag was set in the dwCopyFlagsmember of the structure passed to the CopyFile2 function.

member.name: COPYFILE2_MESSAGE_ACTION.COPYFILE2_PROGRESS_QUIET
member.summary: Continue the copy operation but do not call theCopyFile2ProgressRoutine callback function again for this operation.

member.name: COPYFILE2_MESSAGE_ACTION.COPYFILE2_PROGRESS_PAUSE
member.summary: Pause the copy operation and write a restart header. This value is not compatible with theCOPY_FILE_RESTARTABLE flag for the dwCopyFlags member of the structure. In most cases the call will fail and return HRESULT_FROM_WIN32(ERROR_REQUEST_PAUSED) and any partially copied fragments will be left intact (except for the header written that is used to resume the copy operation later.) In case the copy operation was complete at the time the pause request is processed theCopyFile2 call will complete successfully and no resume header will be written. After this value is processed one more callback will be made to theCopyFile2ProgressRoutine with the message specifying a COPYFILE2_CALLBACK_STREAM_FINISHED (4) value in theType member of the structure. After the callback has returned CopyFile2 will fail withHRESULT_FROM_WIN32(ERROR_REQUEST_PAUSED).
